p: Serious Cd-induced renal damage may be associated with elevated serum levels of urea, uric acid, and creatinine owing to leakage into the bloodstream [ 36, 37]. In the present study, significantly increased levels of urea, uric acid, and creatinine in serum were also reported after Cd exposure for 7 days, which confirmed the severe renal injury ( Figure 1). The observed results corroborate previous studies [ 19, 38]. Administration of TSA oil at both doses (100 and 200 mg/kg, PO) significantly improves renal dysfunction induced by Cd that was supported by the decreased serum levels of urea, uric acid, and creatinine.
